intro: Ampelocissus venenosa, commonly known as the poison vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its tendrils that allow it to攀援 on various structures. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive heart-shaped appearance. However, it is toxic, containing compounds that can be harmful if ingested.
